com.satori.rtm

Class RtmClientBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.satori.rtm.RtmClientBuilder

  • public class RtmClientBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    An RtmClient builder class.

    The following example demonstrates how to use RtmClientBuilder to get an RTM client: 

     RtmClient client = new RtmClientBuilder(YOUR_ENDPOINT, YOUR_APPKEY)
   // Sets a proxy server for the connection to RTM
   .setProxy(URI.create("http://127.0.0.1:3128"))
   // Sets a listener for RTM lifecycle events
   .setListener(new RtmClientAdapter() {
     // When the client successfully connects to RTM
     @Override
     public void onEnterConnected(RtmClient client) {
       System.out.println("Connected to Satori RTM!");
     }
   })
   // Builds the client instance
   .build();

    NOTES:

    • The order in which you call the "set" methods doesn't matter
    • Get the values for YOUR_ENDPOINT and YOUR_APPKEY from your Satori project page, which you access in the Dev Portal.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RtmClientBuilder

        public RtmClientBuilder(java.lang.String endpoint,
                        java.lang.String appKey)
        Constructs a new client builder with the endpoint and the appkey.

        Use RtmClientBuilder to build an RtmClient with various configuration settings. RtmClientBuilder uses the builder pattern. First, call configuration methods to set desired options, and then call build().

        Get the values for endpoint and appKey from your Satori project page, which you access in the Dev Portal.

        Parameters:
        endpoint - endpoint from your project page in Dev Portal
        appKey - appkey from your project page in Dev Portal

    • Method Detail

      • build

        public RtmClient build()
        Builds an RtmClient with the configured properties.

        Call this method after you've set properties.

        Returns:
        RTM client

      • setConnectionTimeout

        public RtmClientBuilder setConnectionTimeout(int connectionTimeout)
        Sets a socket connection timeout.

        If the client fails to connect to the RTM with the specified timeout, the RTM SDK passes an exception to the TransportListener.onConnectingError(java.lang.Exception) callback.

        The default interval is , in milliseconds. Zero timeout is interpreted as an infinite timeout.

        Parameters:
        connectionTimeout - interval, in milliseconds, to wait for a connection
        Returns:
        the current builder object
        See Also:
        setListener(RtmClientListener)

      • setProxy

        public RtmClientBuilder setProxy(java.net.URI proxyUri)
        Sets a proxy server for the RTM client.

        If the URI contains a scheme part and its value is "https" (case-insensitive) then TLS is enabled.

        If the URI contains a userinfo part then it's used for authentication.

        Parameters:
        proxyUri - proxy server identifier
        Returns:
        the current builder object

      • setPendingActionQueueLength

        public RtmClientBuilder setPendingActionQueueLength(int pendingActionQueueLength)
        Sets the length of offline queue.

        The offline queue is used to temporarily store the user's actions when a connection to RTM isn't established. These actions are performed when client reconnects to RTM.

        A length of zero disables the offline queue. The default value is .

        Parameters:
        pendingActionQueueLength - length of the offline queue
        Returns:
        the current builder object

      • setMaxReconnectInterval

        public RtmClientBuilder setMaxReconnectInterval(long maxReconnectInterval)
        Sets the maximum time to wait between reconnection attempts.

        The Satori RTM SDK uses the following formula to calculate the interval between reconnection attempts:

        min(maxReconnectInterval, jitter + minReconnectInterval * (2 ^ (attemptNumber))

        This value steadily increases between attempts until it reaches the maximum time.

        The waiting period applies whenever the client reconnects, regardless of why it disconnected.

        Parameters:
        maxReconnectInterval - maximum waiting time, in milliseconds. The default is
        Returns:
        the current builder object

      • setMinReconnectInterval

        public RtmClientBuilder setMinReconnectInterval(long minReconnectInterval)
        Sets the minimum time to wait between reconnection attempts.

        The Satori RTM SDK uses the following formula to calculate the interval between reconnection attempts:

        min(maxReconnectInterval, jitter + minReconnectInterval * (2 ^ (attemptNumber))

        This value steadily increases between attempts until it reaches the maximum time.

        The waiting period applies whenever the client reconnects, regardless of why it disconnected.

        Parameters:
        minReconnectInterval - minimum waiting period, in milliseconds. The default is
        Returns:
        the current builder object

      • setListener

        public RtmClientBuilder setListener(RtmClientListener listener)
        Sets an client listener that has callback methods to handle client state changes, connection events and error conditions.
        Parameters:
        listener - event listener
        Returns:
        the current builder object

      • setTransportFactory

        @Deprecated
public RtmClientBuilder setTransportFactory(TransportFactory transportFactory)
        Deprecated. use setTransportFactory(AbstractTransportFactory)
        Sets the WebSocket transport used by the client.

        By default, the RTM SDK uses the nv-websocket-client WebSocket client implementation. setTransportFactory lets you use a different WebSocket implementation.

        Parameters:
        transportFactory - WebSocket transport factory.
        Returns:
        RtmClientBuilder instance.

      • setTransportFactory

        public RtmClientBuilder setTransportFactory(AbstractTransportFactory transportFactory)
        Sets the WebSocket transport factory used by the client.

        By default, the RTM SDK uses the nv-websocket-client WebSocket client implementation. setTransportFactory lets you use a different WebSocket implementation.

        Parameters:
        transportFactory - WebSocket transport factory.
        Returns:
        the current builder object

      • setAuthProvider

        public RtmClientBuilder setAuthProvider(AuthProvider authProvider)
        Sets an authenticator for the client.

        The RTM SDK automatically authenticates the RTM client immediately after a connection to RTM is established.

        The RTM SDK includes RoleSecretAuthProvider, which offers role-based authentication. Use role-based authentication to request specific permissions for the RTM client. To manage roles and channel permissions, go to your project in the Dev Portal.

        Parameters:
        authProvider - authentication provider
        Returns:
        the current builder object

      • setAutoReconnect

        public RtmClientBuilder setAutoReconnect(boolean isAutoReconnect)
        Sets the automatic reconnection flag for the client.

        By default, the client automatically tries to reconnect to RTM if the connection fails.

        Parameters:
        isAutoReconnect - set to true to enable automatic reconnect, or false to disable it
        Returns:
        the current builder object

      • setScheduler

        public RtmClientBuilder setScheduler(java.util.concurrent.ScheduledExecutorService service)
        Sets a scheduler to run delayed or periodic tasks. If not specified, the RTM SDK uses a single-threaded executor service.

        This method is intended for advanced users who want control over client task execution.

        Parameters:
        service - task scheduler
        Returns:
        the current builder object

      • setDispatcher

        public RtmClientBuilder setDispatcher(java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService dispatcher,
                                      boolean shouldDispatchTransport)
        Sets an event dispatcher that executes user actions and transport events. If not specified, the RTM SDK provides a dispatcher that executes events sequentially in first-in first-out order.

        This method is intended for advanced users who want control over client task execution.

        Parameters:
        dispatcher - event dispatcher
        shouldDispatchTransport - if true, the dispatcher executes transport events, otherwise a dispatcher isn't used for transport events
        Returns:
        the current builder object

      • setJsonSerializer

        public RtmClientBuilder setJsonSerializer(Serializer serializer)
        Sets the JSON serializer for the client.

        The RTM SDK supports two JSON libraries: google-gson and Jackson2. See the Java RTM SDK GitHub repository documentation for the JSON Library for more details.

        Parameters:
        serializer - JSON serializer
        Returns:
        the current builder object
